docs.snippet: Asian stocks fell for a third day Monday amid mounting fears about U.S.-Chinese trade tensions.

headline.print_headline: Asian Stocks Fall for 3rd Day on US-China Trade Tensions
headline.main: Asian Stocks Fall for 3rd Day on US-China Trade Tensions

docs.snippet: Naveen Kumar, a member of a far-right Hindu group, was held in connection with the death of Ms. Lankesh, a critic of the government.

headline.print_headline: Suspect Held in Indian Journalist’s Death
headline.main: Suspect Detained in Killing of the Indian Journalist Gauri Lankesh

docs.snippet: Certain batches of the company’s Gem 65 8-in-1 Multicooker may have an overheating problem, but the wildly popular pressure cooker is not affected.

headline.print_headline: Stop Worrying! Your Instant Pot Is Safe
headline.main: Stop Worrying! Your Instant Pot Is Safe

docs.snippet: British consultancy firm Cambridge Analytica lies at the center of a storm for using data obtained from millions of Facebook users without their permission after it was hired by Donald Trump for his 2016 U.S. presidential election campaign.

headline.print_headline: What Are the Links Between Cambridge Analytica and a Brexit Campaign Group?
headline.main: What Are the Links Between Cambridge Analytica and a Brexit Campaign Group?

docs.snippet: EU leaders will consider on Thursday how best to enter trade dialogue with U.S. President Donald Trump, whose planned tariffs on steel and aluminium have threatened to trigger a trade war.

headline.print_headline: EU Leaders to Weigh How to Talk Trade With Trump as Tariffs Loom
headline.main: EU Leaders to Weigh How to Talk Trade With Trump as Tariffs Loom

docs.snippet: U.S. stock indexes struggled to find direction Wednesday, ending the choppy day of trading with a loss for the second straight day.

headline.print_headline: US Stock Indexes End Choppy Day of Trading Slightly Lower
headline.main: US Stock Indexes End Choppy Day of Trading Slightly Lower

docs.snippet: European shares slid on Wednesday as worries over a possible trade war dented sentiment and investors awaited the conclusion of a U.S. Federal Reserve meeting for signals on the pace of expected interest rate rises.

headline.print_headline: Trade War Worries Weigh on European Shares Ahead of Fed
headline.main: Trade War Worries Weigh on European Shares Ahead of Fed

docs.snippet: Wall Street tumbled on Friday with more than 1,000 points knocked off the Dow in two days as investors, increasingly nervous about a potential U.S. trade war with China, shied away from risk ahead of the weekend and sought shelter from further los...

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Nosedives as Investors Flee on Trade War Fears
headline.main: Wall Street Nosedives as Investors Flee on Trade War Fears
